column4: hello can someone help me with ssh? I want to set it up so I can ssh from outside my lan
port forward port 22/TCP in your routr to the IP of the system running the ssh server
sure
maybe the mobile network blocks pings
the host name will not resolve to your WAN IP unless you add it in your system's hosts file
you need to check the port forwarding in the router
I can connect to your IP
obviously I don't have credentials
I did a whois on you and it gave a hostname. I then SSH'd to it and got asked for credentials
I can't get in, I don't have an account. But I hit an SSH server
how do you mean 'will not work'?
what are yu trying to do with transmission?
I do the same, did you enable the web UI?
and what port is it using?
then match that port in the port forwarding the same way you setup SSH
you can use SFTP which you get with openssh-server and access your data from anywhere
have you configured any firewalling on the server?
nautilus can do it, no need for 'commands'
you have a router so you'll be fine
tried changing the port number then resetting up the port forward?
so how is this an ubuntu issue if the server is arch?
but this channel is OS specific
the server OS is arch
if you are having issues with the server then ask in the arch channel
